decks.notes: This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of small, aggressive creatures, backed up by powerful enchantments like Legion's Landing and History of Benalia. It also includes cards like Conclave Tribunal and Deputy of Detention to deal with any threats the opponent may have. The goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game, utilizing cards like Venerated Loxodon and Benalish Marshal to buff up the smaller creatures. The key strategy is to outpace the opponent and win through sheer numbers and efficient aggression.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger early on to quickly build up a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruptive cards like Hostage Taker and Plaguecrafter to control the opponent's board. The deck is able to generate card advantage and gain life through cards like Hydroid Krasis and Vivien Reid. Additionally, the deck has a versatile removal package with cards like Assassin's Trophy, Vraska's Contempt, and Find / Finality to deal with any threats the opponent may have.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build a wide board presence with efficient creatures like Emmara, Soul of the Accord and Incubation Druid, as well as generating additional bodies with cards like History of Benalia and March of the Multitudes. The deck also aims to gain incremental advantage with cards like Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants and Trostani Discordant. The inclusion of Hydroid Krasis provides additional card draw and life gain, while cards like Baffling End and Conclave Tribunal help control the opponent's threats. The mana base of the deck aims to consistently cast its spells on curve.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using powerful removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. The deck focuses on maintaining board presence with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Kaya's Wrath while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thought Erasure and Vraska's Contempt. The deck also includes cards like Search for Azcanta and Chemister's Insight to help generate card advantage and dig for key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of control tools such as Negate, Absorb, and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with efficient removal like Mortify and Vraska's Contempt, this deck can dismantle threats while generating card advantage with cards like Search for Azcanta and Precognitive Perception. The goal is to outlast the opponent and ultimately win through attrition and overwhelming board control.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to utilize cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Kaya's Wrath to establish board control and disrupt the opponent's plans. It also focuses on card draw and selection with cards like Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta to ensure a steady stream of resources. The deck utilizes a limited number of win conditions, such as Chromium, the Mutable, to close out the game once it has gained control.

The deck is focused on utilizing Wilderness Reclamation and Nexus of Fate to take extra turns and generate a large amount of mana to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes card draw spells like Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta to find important pieces of the combo. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria is included for additional control and card advantage. The deck aims to create a loop of taking extra turns, drawing cards, and generating mana to ultimately win the game through overwhelming advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. This is achieved by using a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Kaya, Orzhov Usurper, along with targeted removal like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt. The deck also includes card draw and selection tools such as Precognitive Perception and Search for Azcanta to maintain resources. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent, while disrupting their game plan through controlling the board and hand.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures and powerful creature buffs. By flooding the board with small, efficient creatures like Adanto Vanguard, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Snubhorn Sentry, and then boosting their strength with cards like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon, the goal is to quickly build a threatening board presence that can quickly overpower the opponent. Support cards like History of Benalia and Conclave Tribunal help to solidify the board advantage and clear the way for continuous attacks.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering and removing threats while generating card advantage and ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation. The deck focuses on efficient card draw and manipulation, along with utilizing powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Electrodominance to finish the game or swing the tempo in your favor. By combining control elements with powerful spells and land ramp, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a 1 vs 1 setting.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost, aggressive white creatures in order to quickly build a wide board presence and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Adanto Vanguard, Benalish Marshal, and Venerated Loxodon, the deck aims to quickly pump out powerful threats while also protecting them with cards like Dauntless Bodyguard and Conclave Tribunal. History of Benalia helps to further strengthen the board while Legion's Landing provides additional creatures and mana ramp. Overall, the strategy is to play fast and swarm the opponent with a relentless assault of Weenie White creatures.

The main focus of this Esper Control deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and removal spells like Kaya's Wrath and Vraska's Contempt. The deck also includes counterspells like Absorb and Negate to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, card advantage is gained through cards like Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta, allowing the player to draw into key pieces and stay ahead in resources. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory through attrition and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with evasive creatures like Merfolk Trickster and Mist-Cloaked Herald, protecting them with counter spells like Spell Pierce and Wizard's Retort, and buffing them with Curious Obsession. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and maintain control of the board through counter spells and protection spells like Dive Down. The inclusion of Sphinx of Foresight and Warkite Marauder adds versatility and disruption to the deck's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting your opponent's hand with cards like Thought Erasure and countering their spells with cards like Syncopate and Absorb. Kaya's Wrath and other removal spells help to clear the board of threats while card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and Karn, Scion of Urza provide card advantage. With powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Chromium, the Mutable, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win the game through attrition.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures to quickly build up board presence and pressure opponent's life total. It utilizes graveyard recursion with Find // Finality and Memorial to Folly to maintain card advantage and board control. The inclusion of Vraska, Relic Seeker and Vivien Reid provide additional removal and card advantage options. Wildgrowth Walker gains life and swings the tempo in your favor, while Hydroid Krasis serves as a versatile finisher. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient threats and recursive capabilities.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence and deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By utilizing cheap spells and creatures, the UR Aggro deck aims to control the pace of the game while being aggressive in its attacks. The deck includes a mix of flying creatures, burn spells, and cantrips to ensure consistency in drawing cards and dealing damage. By efficiently using its resources, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.
